headline: Asia-Pacific Companies and Local Governments Sell $1,500,000,000,000 in Bonds As Investors Flee US Dollar Assets: Report
summary: Companies and non-sovereign issuers in the Asia-Pacific region have been hawking bonds at a record rate as investors look to move away from US dollar assets, according to a new Bloomberg report. Non-sovereign issuers are non-federal bond issuers like local and regional governments and public agencies. Bloomberg reports that Asia-Pacific companies and non-sovereign issuers have sold $1.5 trillion in local-currency bonds year-to-date, a record in that time frame. The sales represent a 6% increase. Daniel Tan, a portfolio manager for global emerging markets at Grasshopper Asset Management, tells Bloomberg the number of bond buyers has surged in the second quarter of the year. “We are definitely seeing more buyers of local-currency Asian bonds than in pre-April. There are large inflows from pension and sovereign wealth funds looking to diversify away from US dollar assets.” US President Donald Trump kicked off his wave of tariffs in April, spurring macroeconomic uncertainty. Angus Hui, the deputy chief investment officer at the Singapore-based investment firm Fullerton Fund Management, tells Bloomberg that “diversification into broader Asian local currency markets is likely to accelerate.” The Bloomberg Asia-Pacific Aggregate index, a multi-currency benchmark based on Asia-Pacific investment-grade bonds, has beaten the US-based bond metric, gaining 3.9% year-to-date compared to 3.5%, respectively. headline: Bitcoin Transfers Trigger Massive $4B Short Surge
summary: BitcoinWorld Bitcoin Transfers Trigger Massive $4B Short Surge The cryptocurrency market is a dynamic beast, constantly reacting to a myriad of factors, from macroeconomic shifts to the subtle movements of whales. Recently, a significant event sent ripples across major exchanges, highlighting the intricate dance between large asset movements and market sentiment. We’re talking about a staggering $4 billion surge in short positions, directly coinciding with substantial Bitcoin transfers to key platforms. This isn’t just a number; it’s a flashing signal for anyone tracking the digital asset space. Decoding the Signal: What Exactly are These Bitcoin Transfers? According to Julio Moreno, the Head of Research at CryptoQuant, a leading on-chain analytics firm, the past 24 hours saw a dramatic increase in open interest on several prominent exchanges. Specifically, Binance, Bybit, and Gate.io collectively witnessed a sharp $4 billion rise in open interest. This surge wasn’t isolated; it occurred precisely when a significant volume of Bitcoin transfers landed on these platforms. But what does this really mean? Large-Scale Movements: These weren’t your everyday retail transactions. The sheer volume suggests institutional players, whales, or large-scale traders moving substantial amounts of BTC. Open Interest Explained: Open interest (OI) represents the total number of outstanding derivative contracts, such as futures or options, that have not yet been settled. A rise in OI indicates new money flowing into the market, either from new long (buy) or short (sell) positions. Exchange Concentration: The fact that Binance and Bybit reportedly received a significant portion of the transferred BTC is crucial. These are major hubs for both spot and derivatives trading, making them prime locations for market-moving activities. When large Bitcoin transfers hit exchanges, it often precedes significant price action. Traders watch these movements closely, as they can signal impending liquidity shifts or strategic positioning by major market participants. The $4 Billion Short Surge: A Bearish Bet or Strategic Play? The most intriguing aspect of CryptoQuant’s report is the implication that this massive rise in open interest was primarily driven by an increase in short positions. For those new to derivatives, a short position is essentially a bet that the price of an asset will fall. Traders borrow an asset, sell it, and aim to buy it back at a lower price later, profiting from the difference. A $4 billion short surge is a substantial amount, indicating a strong conviction among a segment of the market that Bitcoin’s price might be heading downwards. Why Would Large Bitcoin Transfers Lead to Short Positions? This is the million-dollar question. Several theories could explain this correlation: Anticipation of Price Correction: Whales or large entities might be moving BTC to exchanges with the intent to sell, or to open short positions in anticipation of a market correction after a period of gains. They might be hedging against their existing spot holdings. Arbitrage Opportunities: Large transfers could be part of an arbitrage strategy, where discrepancies in prices across different exchanges or derivatives markets are exploited. This often involves taking opposing positions (long on one, short on another) to lock in profits. Liquidation Fuel: Sometimes, large transfers are used to provide collateral for massive short positions, aiming to push the price down and potentially trigger liquidations of long positions, further exacerbating a downtrend. Market Manipulation: While difficult to prove, large, coordinated movements can sometimes be part of a strategy to influence market sentiment and price direction. The fact that Binance and Bybit, known for their robust derivatives platforms, received a significant portion of these Bitcoin transfers lends weight to the theory that these movements were intended to facilitate large-scale derivatives trading, specifically shorting. Are These Bitcoin Transfers a Definitive Bearish Signal? While a surge in short positions often suggests bearish sentiment, it’s crucial to avoid jumping to conclusions. The crypto market is notoriously complex, and single data points rarely tell the whole story. Here’s why: Hedging Strategies: Many institutional players and whales use short positions to hedge their existing spot holdings. If they hold a large amount of Bitcoin, they might open short positions to protect against potential price drops without selling their underlying assets. This is a common risk management strategy. Market Liquidity: Large transfers to exchanges can also be for increasing liquidity for various trading pairs, or for over-the-counter (OTC) deals that don’t directly impact the public order books initially. Potential for Short Squeezes: A large accumulation of short positions can also create conditions for a “short squeeze.” If Bitcoin’s price unexpectedly rises, short sellers are forced to buy back BTC to cover their positions, which can rapidly drive the price even higher, leading to a cascade of liquidations. Therefore, while the $4 billion short surge is a significant development, it’s essential to consider it within the broader context of market structure, overall sentiment, and other on-chain metrics. It’s a signal of increased volatility and directional conviction from some large players, but not necessarily a guaranteed downturn. Navigating the Volatility: Actionable Insights for Traders In a market where significant Bitcoin transfers can trigger multi-billion dollar shifts in open interest, staying informed and prepared is paramount. Here are some actionable insights for traders and investors: Monitor On-Chain Data: Tools like CryptoQuant provide invaluable insights into whale movements, exchange flows, and open interest. Integrating such data into your analysis can give you an edge. Understand Derivatives: If you’re trading futures or options, a deep understanding of open interest, funding rates, and liquidation levels is crucial. These metrics can reveal underlying market pressures. Implement Robust Risk Management: Given the potential for increased volatility, always use stop-loss orders to limit potential losses. Avoid over-leveraging, especially when market signals are mixed or highly speculative. Diversify Your Portfolio: Don’t put all your eggs in one basket. Diversifying across different assets can help mitigate risks associated with sudden price movements in a single asset like Bitcoin. Stay Informed, Not Reactive: While it’s important to be aware of such significant market events, avoid making impulsive decisions. Combine on-chain data with technical analysis, fundamental analysis, and a long-term perspective. Consider the Broader Market Context: Look beyond just Bitcoin. How are altcoins performing? What are the macroeconomic indicators? Geopolitical events? All these factors can influence crypto prices. The market’s reaction to these large Bitcoin transfers and the subsequent short surge underscores the interconnectedness of various market components. It’s a reminder that transparency in blockchain data offers unique opportunities for informed decision-making, but also demands careful interpretation. Conclusion: The Ever-Evolving Bitcoin Landscape The recent revelation of a $4 billion short surge coinciding with significant Bitcoin transfers to major exchanges like Binance, Bybit, and Gate.io is a powerful testament to the dynamic and often unpredictable nature of the cryptocurrency market. While it signals a strong bearish conviction from a segment of large players, it also highlights the multifaceted reasons behind such movements, ranging from hedging to strategic market positioning. For market participants, this event serves as a crucial reminder of the importance of vigilance, informed analysis, and robust risk management. As Bitcoin continues to mature and attract larger capital flows, understanding the nuances of on-chain data and derivatives markets will become increasingly vital. The future of Bitcoin’s price action will undoubtedly be shaped by these complex interactions, making every transfer and every open interest shift a piece of the larger puzzle. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) 1. What is Open Interest (OI) in crypto derivatives? Open Interest (OI) represents the total number of outstanding or unsettled derivative contracts (like futures or options) in the market. A rising OI indicates new money entering the market, while a falling OI suggests contracts are being closed. 2. What does a “short surge” signify in the crypto market? A “short surge” means there’s a significant increase in the number of short positions being opened. This generally indicates that a large number of traders, often institutional or whale entities, are betting on a future price decline of the underlying asset. 3. Why would large Bitcoin transfers coincide with a rise in short positions? Large Bitcoin transfers to exchanges can serve multiple purposes. They might be moved to provide collateral for opening massive short positions, to sell directly into the market, or as part of a hedging strategy to protect existing spot holdings against anticipated price drops. 4. Are these Bitcoin transfers a guaranteed bearish signal for BTC price? Not necessarily. While a short surge often implies bearish sentiment, it could also be part of a hedging strategy, an arbitrage play, or even set the stage for a future short squeeze if the price unexpectedly rises. It’s a signal of increased volatility and directional conviction, but not a definitive prediction. 5. Which exchanges were primarily affected by this event? According to CryptoQuant’s Head of Research, Julio Moreno, Binance, Bybit, and Gate.io were the major exchanges that saw the sharp $4 billion rise in open interest coinciding with the large Bitcoin transfers. 6. How can traders protect themselves during such volatile periods? Traders can protect themselves by implementing robust risk management strategies such as using stop-loss orders, avoiding excessive leverage, diversifying their portfolios, and combining on-chain data analysis with technical and fundamental insights. If you found this analysis insightful, consider sharing it with your network! Stay ahead of the curve by understanding the complex dynamics of the crypto market. Your shares help us bring more valuable insights to the community. To learn more about the latest Bitcoin market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin price action . This post Bitcoin Transfers Trigger Massive $4B Short Surge first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

headline: Weekly Crypto Regulation News Roundup: GENIUS Act Hits Big Tech, SEC Reverses on ETF
summary: This week, the crypto regulatory landscape was thrown into sharp relief as U.S. lawmakers and agencies issued new frameworks, reversed approvals, and closed long-running investigations. A clear message emerged: the U.S. is moving quickly to shape the next phase of digital asset oversight, with both Congress and federal agencies playing pivotal roles. GENIUS Act Draws Line Against Big Tech in Stablecoins One of the most notable updates comes from the recently enacted GENIUS Act, which includes a provision aimed squarely at preventing Big Tech and Wall Street from dominating the stablecoin sector. Commonly referred to as the “Libra clause,” the rule references Meta’s failed global currency project and reflects regulators’ determination to avoid similar power consolidation in future digital money systems. A provision in GENIUS Act aims to curb the influence of tech conglomerates and major financial institutions in the US stablecoin market. #GENIUS #Stablecoins https://t.co/IE7FZdWjXw — Cryptonews.com (@cryptonews) July 21, 2025 Under this clause, any non-bank firm aiming to issue a dollar-backed stablecoin must establish a separate, standalone legal entity to house the operation. That entity would be required to undergo antitrust scrutiny and secure clearance from a Treasury-led oversight committee, which holds veto power. Banks are also subject to restrictions. They must issue stablecoins through legally distinct subsidiaries that are prohibited from engaging in leverage, lending, or any activity that could pose broader financial risks. This creates a highly controlled environment, with boundaries that Circle’s Chief Strategy Officer Dante Disparte described as more conservative than deposit-token models being explored by large financial institutions like JPMorgan. The measure shows an aggressive push by U.S. regulators to ensure the stablecoin space does not replicate past issues of too-big-to-fail institutions dominating financial infrastructure. It also sets the stage for a broader reimagining of how the U.S. will handle fiat-backed digital assets in the years to come. Senate Introduces Market Structure Framework for Crypto Building on the momentum of the GENIUS Act, the Senate Banking Committee unveiled a new draft bill designed to restructure how digital assets are classified and regulated. Titled the Responsible Financial Innovation Act of 2025, the bill is co-sponsored by Senators Tim Scott, Cynthia Lummis, Bill Hagerty, and Bernie Moreno. Senate Banking Chair @SenatorTimScott , @CynthiaMLummis , @SenatorHagerty , @BernieMoreno release a draft on crypto market structure—seeking feedback on 35+ topics. #CryptoMarket #CryptoPolicy https://t.co/XUh532lA9j — Cryptonews.com (@cryptonews) July 22, 2025 This new legislation attempts to address long-standing confusion in the crypto sector by providing a clearer framework for when tokens should be treated as commodities versus securities. It draws from prior legislative attempts such as the bipartisan Lummis-Gillibrand proposal and incorporates elements of the House-passed CLARITY Act. By creating consistent regulatory definitions and assigning clearer jurisdictional responsibilities to the SEC and the CFTC, the bill hopes to provide digital asset companies with the certainty they’ve long asked for. It also represents growing bipartisan awareness that crypto markets need regulation — but not at the cost of innovation. If passed, the bill could fundamentally change how digital assets are launched, traded, and reported in the U.S. market. DOJ Drops Case Against Jesse Powell In another headline-grabbing twist, the U.S. Department of Justice has reportedly closed its investigation into Kraken founder Jesse Powell, ending a legal saga that began with a raid on his home in 2023. The Department of Justice has dropped its probe into Kraken founder Jesse Powell, a new report from Fortune alleges. https://t.co/NmCr5ZbobH — Cryptonews.com (@cryptonews) July 22, 2025 The probe originated from a management dispute tied to the Verge Center for the Arts, a nonprofit Powell helped co-found. Allegations included cyberstalking and unauthorized access to sensitive information. While Powell has strongly denied the accusations, federal agents had seized multiple devices from his home during the investigation. According to recent reports, the DOJ has since returned the seized equipment and dropped all charges, implicitly affirming Powell’s version of events. The Kraken founder had filed a civil lawsuit against members of the nonprofit’s board, citing reputational damage and false claims. The case’s closure removes a major legal cloud from one of the industry’s more high-profile figures and marks a rare example of federal prosecutors walking back a high-profile crypto-related investigation. SEC’s Sudden Reversal on Bitwise ETF Stuns Markets In a move that rattled investor confidence, the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) granted — and then rescinded — approval for Bitwise’s 10 Crypto Index ETF within a matter of hours. SEC Hits Pause on Bitwise ETF Offering Broad Crypto Exposure The US Securities and Exchange Commission approved and then immediately paused the conversion of Bitwise’s crypto index fund into an exchange-traded fund, leaving it in limbo pending a review. The SEC's Division of… — Cryptonews.com (@cryptonews) July 25, 2025 The ETF was designed to track a diversified basket of cryptocurrencies including Bitcoin, Ethereum, Solana, XRP, and others, with 85% of its weighting in already-approved assets. NYSE Arca had received accelerated approval to amend its rules for listing the multi-asset fund. But that decision was quickly stayed by the SEC’s Assistant Secretary Sherry Haywood under Rule 431. The Commission said it would conduct further review of the action taken by its Division of Trading and Markets. The reversal is especially notable because it came despite the SEC initially finding the fund consistent with investor protection and anti-fraud standards under the Exchange Act. This abrupt about-face comes as more than 70 crypto-related ETF applications — from major firms like Grayscale, VanEck, and Franklin Templeton — await decisions. It also raises concerns over how internal divisions at the SEC may be affecting the consistency and clarity of crypto asset approvals. This week’s developments show that the regulatory environment for crypto in the U.S. is rapidly evolving — and still unstable in key ways. While Congress is beginning to offer structure through bills like the GENIUS Act and the Responsible Financial Innovation Act, federal agencies are still sending mixed signals. The post Weekly Crypto Regulation News Roundup: GENIUS Act Hits Big Tech, SEC Reverses on ETF appeared first on Cryptonews .

headline: Bitcoin Price Prediction: Citibank Unveils Stunning $199K Target
summary: BitcoinWorld Bitcoin Price Prediction: Citibank Unveils Stunning $199K Target The cryptocurrency world is abuzz with a new forecast that has captivated investors and enthusiasts alike. A major player in traditional finance, Citibank, has reportedly thrown its hat into the ring with a stunning Bitcoin price prediction , suggesting the digital asset could reach an unprecedented value by the end of the year. This isn’t just a casual guess; it’s a projection from a global financial powerhouse, sparking considerable discussion and speculation across the market. What exactly did Citibank say, and what could this mean for the future of the world’s leading cryptocurrency? What’s Behind Citibank’s Bold Bitcoin Price Prediction? In a move that underscores the growing mainstream acceptance of cryptocurrencies, Citibank has reportedly shared its highly anticipated Bitcoin price prediction . According to reports by The Crypto Basic, the financial giant projects a potential surge for Bitcoin (BTC) to a staggering $199,000 by the close of this year . This isn’t merely an optimistic outlook; it’s presented as their bullish case, indicating a scenario where several favorable factors align to propel Bitcoin to new heights. Such a significant forecast from an institution like Citibank carries considerable weight. It suggests a deeper analysis and understanding of the cryptocurrency market, moving beyond the skepticism often associated with traditional financial entities. This prediction isn’t just a number; it reflects a growing institutional belief in Bitcoin’s long-term value proposition and its potential to disrupt traditional financial systems. However, it’s crucial to understand that financial predictions, especially in the volatile crypto market, are rarely set in stone. Citibank, acknowledging this inherent uncertainty, has also provided a range of scenarios to offer a more comprehensive view of Bitcoin’s potential trajectory. Diving Deeper: Citibank’s Multi-Tiered Bitcoin Price Prediction Scenarios While the headline-grabbing $199,000 figure represents Citibank’s most optimistic outlook, their analysis is far more nuanced. To provide a balanced perspective, the institution has reportedly outlined three distinct scenarios for its Bitcoin price prediction : The Bullish Case: $199,000 by Year-End This is the projection that has captured significant attention. It suggests a confluence of positive market drivers, potentially including increased institutional adoption, favorable regulatory developments, sustained retail interest, and perhaps a post-halving supply shock, could push Bitcoin to unprecedented levels. This scenario implies a strong demand outpacing available supply, leading to significant price appreciation. The Base Case: $135,000 Considered the “realistic” projection, the base case suggests Bitcoin could settle around $135,000. This scenario likely factors in a more moderate growth trajectory, acknowledging potential market corrections or slower adoption rates compared to the bullish scenario. It represents a more conservative yet still highly positive outlook for Bitcoin’s performance. The Bearish Case: $64,000 by End of 2025 Citibank also provides a bearish Bitcoin price prediction , projecting Bitcoin to finish up 2025 at $64,000. It’s important to note the timeframe here – this bearish outlook extends into the following year, suggesting a potential prolonged period of consolidation or correction. Factors contributing to such a scenario could include unexpected regulatory crackdowns, significant macroeconomic downturns, or a loss of investor confidence due to unforeseen events. This multi-tiered approach highlights the inherent uncertainties in forecasting future asset prices, especially for a nascent and volatile asset class like cryptocurrency. It provides investors with a spectrum of possibilities, allowing them to assess risk and potential returns based on different market conditions. Why Does This Bitcoin Price Prediction Matter? The significance of Citibank’s Bitcoin price prediction extends far beyond mere numbers. It represents several crucial developments in the broader financial landscape: Institutional Validation: When a venerable institution like Citibank issues such a forecast, it lends significant credibility to Bitcoin as a legitimate asset class. It signals that major financial players are not only observing but actively analyzing and forecasting the future of digital currencies. Shifting Perceptions: For years, Bitcoin was often dismissed as a niche asset for tech enthusiasts or a tool for illicit activities. Forecasts from mainstream banks challenge these outdated perceptions, helping to normalize Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies in the eyes of traditional investors and the general public. Potential for Increased Investment: Such high-profile predictions can act as a catalyst for new capital inflows. Institutional investors, hedge funds, and even retail investors who have been hesitant might now consider allocating a portion of their portfolios to Bitcoin, seeing it as a viable long-term investment. Market Sentiment Indicator: While not a guarantee, a bullish outlook from a major bank can significantly boost market sentiment. Positive sentiment often fuels buying pressure, creating a self-reinforcing cycle that can contribute to price appreciation. It’s a clear indication that the conversation around Bitcoin has moved from “if” it will survive to “how high” it can go, even within the most conservative financial circles. Navigating the Volatility: Beyond the Bitcoin Price Prediction While Citibank’s Bitcoin price prediction offers an exciting glimpse into the future, it’s essential for investors to approach the cryptocurrency market with a clear understanding of its inherent volatility. Bitcoin’s price movements are influenced by a complex interplay of factors, including: Macroeconomic Conditions: Global inflation rates, interest rate decisions by central banks, and geopolitical events can all impact investor sentiment and, consequently, Bitcoin’s price. Regulatory Developments: News of new regulations, bans, or approvals (like spot Bitcoin ETFs) in major economies can trigger significant price swings. Technological Advancements: Updates to Bitcoin’s protocol, developments in the broader blockchain ecosystem, or the emergence of new competing technologies can also play a role. Market Adoption and Liquidity: Increased adoption by businesses, payment processors, and individual users, alongside higher trading volumes, contributes to Bitcoin’s stability and growth. Halving Events: Bitcoin’s programmed supply reduction events (halvings) historically precede significant bull runs, creating supply shocks that can drive prices higher. Investors should always remember that past performance is not indicative of future results. Diversification, risk management, and a long-term perspective are crucial when investing in such a dynamic asset class. Always conduct your own thorough research (DYOR) and consider consulting a financial advisor before making investment decisions. Is Citibank’s Bitcoin Price Prediction Achievable? The question on everyone’s mind is whether a Bitcoin price prediction of $199,000 is truly within reach. While ambitious, several arguments support the possibility: Scarcity and Halving Cycles: Bitcoin’s fixed supply cap of 21 million coins, combined with its periodic halving events that reduce the rate of new Bitcoin entering circulation, creates inherent scarcity. Historically, halvings have been followed by significant price rallies due to supply shock. Growing Institutional Adoption: The approval of spot Bitcoin ETFs in major markets has opened doors for massive institutional capital. As more traditional investment vehicles gain exposure to Bitcoin, demand could surge dramatically. Macroeconomic Tailwinds: In an era of increasing global debt and potential currency debasement, Bitcoin’s appeal as a decentralized, scarce store of value could grow, attracting investors seeking an alternative to traditional assets. Network Effects: As more individuals, businesses, and developers build on or use the Bitcoin network, its utility and value increase, creating a powerful network effect. However, significant headwinds could also impede such growth. These include unforeseen regulatory challenges, persistent macroeconomic instability, or the emergence of a “black swan” event. The journey to $199,000, if it happens, will likely not be a straight line but rather a volatile path with significant ups and downs. The Broader Implications of Citibank’s Bitcoin Price Prediction Beyond the immediate financial implications, Citibank’s bold Bitcoin price prediction highlights a profound shift in the global financial landscape. It signifies that major financial institutions are no longer merely observing the crypto space from a distance; they are actively engaging with it, recognizing its growing influence and potential. This engagement could pave the way for: More Sophisticated Financial Products: Expect to see more complex financial instruments and services built around cryptocurrencies, catering to institutional and high-net-worth investors. Increased Regulatory Clarity: As more traditional players enter the space, there will be increased pressure for clearer, more consistent regulatory frameworks globally, which can bring stability and legitimacy to the market. Innovation in Financial Services: The adoption of blockchain technology, inspired by Bitcoin, could lead to revolutionary changes in how financial transactions are conducted, settled, and secured. Talent Migration: More talent from traditional finance might migrate to the crypto sector, bringing expertise and further professionalizing the industry. Ultimately, Citibank’s forecast serves as a powerful indicator that Bitcoin, once considered a fringe asset, is steadily cementing its position as a significant force in the global economy. It’s a testament to its resilience, growing adoption, and the evolving perception of digital assets. Summary: What Does This Mean for You? Citibank’s reported Bitcoin price prediction , ranging from a bullish $199,000 to a base case of $135,000 and a bearish $64,000 by 2025, provides a compelling perspective on Bitcoin’s future. While the figures are certainly attention-grabbing, the real takeaway is the growing acceptance and serious analysis of Bitcoin by established financial institutions. This shift validates Bitcoin’s journey from a niche digital experiment to a recognized asset class. For investors, this means continued vigilance, thorough research, and a strategic approach are more important than ever. The path ahead for Bitcoin may be volatile, but the destination, according to some of the world’s leading financial minds, could be remarkably high. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) Q1: What is Citibank’s highest Bitcoin price prediction? Citibank’s most bullish Bitcoin price prediction, as reported by The Crypto Basic, suggests Bitcoin could reach $199,000 by the end of this year. Q2: What are the different scenarios in Citibank’s Bitcoin forecast? Citibank reportedly offers three scenarios: a bullish case of $199,000 by year-end, a base case of $135,000, and a bearish case projecting $64,000 by the end of 2025. Q3: Why is Citibank’s prediction significant? Such a forecast from a major traditional financial institution like Citibank lends significant credibility to Bitcoin as a legitimate asset, signals shifting perceptions, and could encourage increased institutional and retail investment in the cryptocurrency market. Q4: What factors could influence Bitcoin’s price to reach $199,000? Factors include Bitcoin’s scarcity (especially post-halving), growing institutional adoption (e.g., via ETFs), macroeconomic tailwinds positioning Bitcoin as a store of value, and the expanding network effects of its ecosystem. Q5: Should I invest in Bitcoin based on this prediction? While Citibank’s prediction is noteworthy, it’s crucial to remember that all financial forecasts carry risk. Investors should conduct their own thorough research (DYOR), understand Bitcoin’s volatility, and consider their personal financial situation and risk tolerance before making any investment decisions. Consulting a financial advisor is always recommended. If you found this analysis of Citibank’s Bitcoin price prediction insightful, don’t keep it to yourself! Share this article with your friends, family, and fellow crypto enthusiasts on social media. Let’s continue the conversation about the future of Bitcoin and digital finance! headline: Unveiling the Shocking Coinbase Selling Pressure Impact on Bitcoin
summary: BitcoinWorld Unveiling the Shocking Coinbase Selling Pressure Impact on Bitcoin The cryptocurrency market is a dynamic realm, often characterized by swift price movements that can leave even seasoned investors scratching their heads. Recently, the crypto community has been abuzz with discussions surrounding a notable surge in Coinbase selling pressure , a phenomenon that appears to be directly influencing Bitcoin’s recent price adjustments. Understanding these underlying forces is crucial for anyone navigating the volatile digital asset landscape. What’s Driving the Current Coinbase Selling Pressure? In the intricate world of on-chain analysis, every large transaction tells a story. Pseudonymous yet respected on-chain analyst “Murphy” recently brought to light a significant factor contributing to Bitcoin’s recent downturn: substantial inflows into Coinbase, one of the largest cryptocurrency exchanges globally. This isn’t just about a few coins moving; we’re talking about thousands of Bitcoin being deposited, often signaling an intent to sell. Initial Wave: An initial deposit of 4,950 BTC landed on Coinbase, coinciding with Bitcoin’s price falling towards the $115,000 mark. This substantial transfer immediately raised eyebrows among analysts monitoring exchange flows. Second Surge: Just an hour later, another significant tranche of 3,169 BTC was moved onto the same exchange. This follow-up deposit reinforced the notion of sustained selling intent, adding further downward pressure. Total Impact: Combined, these two events saw over 8,100 BTC, worth hundreds of millions of dollars, transferred to Coinbase within a very short period. Such large-scale movements from wallets to exchanges are typically interpreted as a precursor to selling, as traders and whales often move their holdings to exchanges when they intend to liquidate. This concentrated influx of Bitcoin into a major exchange like Coinbase is a key indicator that merits close attention. It suggests that a significant entity, or multiple entities, are offloading substantial amounts of Bitcoin, creating the observed Coinbase selling pressure . Why Do Coinbase Deposits Matter So Much? Coinbase holds a unique position in the crypto ecosystem. As one of the most accessible and regulated exchanges, it serves a wide range of investors, from retail participants to large institutional players. When large sums of Bitcoin are deposited into Coinbase, it can have a disproportionate impact on the market for several reasons: Institutional Presence: Coinbase is often favored by institutional investors due to its regulatory compliance and robust infrastructure. Large deposits here can sometimes signal institutional liquidation or rebalancing, which carries more weight than retail selling. Liquidity Impact: While exchanges have deep order books, a sudden influx of sell orders can quickly absorb available buy-side liquidity, leading to rapid price depreciation. The more Bitcoin available for sale, the greater the potential for price drops if demand doesn’t match supply. Market Sentiment: On-chain data is increasingly used by traders to gauge market sentiment. Significant exchange inflows, especially into a platform like Coinbase, can trigger fear and uncertainty, leading other holders to panic sell, exacerbating the downward trend. This collective reaction amplifies the initial Coinbase selling pressure . Understanding these dynamics is vital. It’s not just the quantity of Bitcoin, but also the context of where it’s moving that provides crucial insights into market movements. Decoding On-Chain Signals: What Does This Tell Us About Market Stages? On-chain analysis is the practice of examining publicly available data on a blockchain to gain insights into market behavior. It’s like looking directly into the ledger of all transactions, providing a transparent view of supply and demand dynamics. In this instance, Murphy’s analysis leverages these insights to draw conclusions about the current market phase. The analyst’s conclusion that this adjustment could be in its “final stages” if no further large-scale deposits occur is a critical point. This suggests a belief that the primary source of the recent Coinbase selling pressure has largely expended its supply. Here’s what that implies: Scenario Market Implication On-Chain Evidence No Further Large Deposits Selling pressure subsides, potential for price stabilization or rebound. Exchange inflows decrease significantly; exchange balances might even start to decline. Continued Large Deposits Selling pressure persists, risk of further price declines. Sustained high exchange inflows, particularly to spot exchanges like Coinbase. Outflows from Exchanges Accumulation phase, bullish signal as coins are moved to cold storage. Net exchange outflows, decrease in exchange balances. This perspective provides a framework for understanding current market behavior, emphasizing that the absence of continued selling pressure is a key factor in determining if the bottom has been reached for this particular adjustment. Navigating Market Volatility: What Should Investors Consider? Market volatility, especially that triggered by significant events like concentrated Coinbase selling pressure , can be unsettling. However, it also presents opportunities for informed decision-making. Here are some actionable insights for investors: Monitor On-Chain Data: While not all investors have the tools to perform deep on-chain analysis, many platforms now provide simplified metrics on exchange flows. Keeping an eye on these trends can offer early warnings or confirmations of market shifts. Diversify Your Portfolio: Relying solely on one asset, even Bitcoin, can expose you to higher risks during periods of concentrated selling. A diversified portfolio can help cushion the impact of sudden price drops in a single asset. Practice Risk Management: Implement strategies like setting stop-loss orders to limit potential losses. Avoid over-leveraging, especially when the market is showing signs of increased selling pressure. Do Your Own Research (DYOR): Always verify information from multiple sources. While pseudonymous analysts can provide valuable insights, cross-referencing their findings with other data points and your own analysis is crucial. Long-Term Perspective: For many, Bitcoin is a long-term investment. Short-term price fluctuations, while impactful, may be less significant when viewed through a multi-year lens. Consider your investment horizon and risk tolerance. Periods of heightened selling pressure, like those originating from Coinbase, are a natural part of market cycles. How you react to them can significantly influence your investment outcomes. Is This the Final Act? The Road Ahead for Bitcoin The analyst’s suggestion that the current adjustment could be in its final stages offers a glimmer of hope for a market rebound. However, it’s important to remember that the crypto market is influenced by a myriad of factors, and a single indicator, no matter how significant, doesn’t tell the whole story. While the immediate Coinbase selling pressure might abate, other elements could come into play: Macroeconomic Factors: Global economic conditions, interest rate decisions, and geopolitical events can all influence investor appetite for risk assets like Bitcoin. Regulatory Developments: New regulations or enforcement actions in major jurisdictions can significantly impact market sentiment and liquidity. Whale Behavior Beyond Coinbase: While Coinbase saw significant inflows, other large holders might be moving Bitcoin on different exchanges or through OTC desks, which are harder to track publicly. Market Sentiment Shift: News events, FUD (Fear, Uncertainty, Doubt), or FOMO (Fear of Missing Out) can rapidly change market psychology, leading to unpredictable price movements. Therefore, while the current on-chain signals from Coinbase are a crucial piece of the puzzle, a holistic view of the market remains essential. The coming days and weeks will reveal whether Murphy’s assessment holds true and if Bitcoin can indeed find its footing after this concentrated selling event. Conclusion: Navigating the Tides of Bitcoin’s Volatility The recent surge in Coinbase selling pressure has undoubtedly sent ripples through the Bitcoin market, illustrating the profound impact that large, concentrated movements on major exchanges can have. The insights from on-chain analysts like “Murphy” provide invaluable transparency into these movements, helping investors understand the ‘why’ behind the price action. While the immediate concern revolves around whether this selling wave has run its course, the broader lesson lies in the importance of diligent market monitoring, robust risk management, and a long-term perspective. As the crypto market continues to mature, the ability to interpret on-chain data becomes an increasingly powerful tool. Whether Bitcoin swiftly recovers or experiences further consolidation, understanding the forces at play, particularly those originating from significant exchange activities, empowers investors to make more informed decisions in this ever-evolving financial frontier. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) Q1: What is ‘on-chain analysis’ and how does it relate to Bitcoin’s price? A1: On-chain analysis involves examining public data on a blockchain, such as transaction volumes, wallet addresses, and exchange flows. It provides insights into supply and demand dynamics, helping analysts predict potential price movements. For instance, large Bitcoin deposits to exchanges (like Coinbase) often signal potential selling pressure, while large withdrawals might indicate accumulation. Q2: Why are Bitcoin deposits to Coinbase considered a significant indicator of selling pressure? A2: Coinbase is a major, regulated exchange popular with both retail and institutional investors. When large amounts of Bitcoin are deposited there, it often means the holders intend to sell, as assets are typically moved off exchanges for long-term holding (cold storage). A sudden influx of Bitcoin to Coinbase can quickly overwhelm buy orders, leading to price drops due to increased supply on the market. Q3: Who is ‘Murphy’ and how reliable are pseudonymous on-chain analysts? A3: ‘Murphy’ is a pseudonymous on-chain analyst who shares insights on platforms like X (formerly Twitter). The reliability of pseudonymous analysts varies; however, many have built strong reputations based on consistently accurate interpretations of publicly verifiable blockchain data. It’s always advisable to cross-reference their findings with other data points and conduct your own research. Q4: What does it mean if the ‘adjustment can be considered to have reached its final stages’? A4: This phrase suggests that the primary source of the recent selling pressure (in this case, large Bitcoin deposits to Coinbase) has largely been exhausted. If no further significant deposits occur, it implies that the market might have absorbed the available supply from these sellers, potentially leading to a stabilization or rebound in Bitcoin’s price. However, this relies on the absence of new selling pressure from other sources. Q5: How can individual investors protect themselves during periods of high selling pressure? A5: During periods of high selling pressure, investors can protect themselves by practicing sound risk management. This includes diversifying their portfolios, setting stop-loss orders to limit potential losses, avoiding over-leveraging, and staying informed through reliable on-chain analysis and market news. Maintaining a long-term perspective can also help mitigate the emotional impact of short-term volatility. If you found this analysis insightful, please consider sharing it with your network! Your support helps us continue to deliver timely and comprehensive cryptocurrency market insights. To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin price action. This post Unveiling the Shocking Coinbase Selling Pressure Impact on Bitcoin first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

headline: Bitcoin Price Prediction: All Eyes on This Descending Triangle Chart Pattern – 100% Move Coming?
summary: The Bitcoin price action remains caught in a tug-of-war between bearish and bullish sentiment, with the cryptocurrency now forming a descending triangle pattern that has encountered significant resistance at the trendline. Currently, the Bitcoin critical support zone lies between $115,000 and $116,000, where bulls have mounted a strong defense. This resilient support has sparked optimism that Bitcoin could potentially achieve a 100% gain, effectively doubling from present price levels. Galaxy Digital and Old Whales are Responsible for the Bitcoin Price Decline The recent market downturn has been primarily attributed to Galaxy Digital’s persistent selling pressure of BTC. In today’s session alone, the firm has offloaded 12.85K BTC valued at approximately $1.5 billion across various exchanges. Update: #GalaxyDigital has transferred nearly 30,000 $BTC ($3.5B) out today, most of which went directly to exchanges and were sold. Then #GalaxyDigital withdrew 1.15B $USDT from exchanges. #GalaxyDigital still holds 18,504 $BTC ($2.14B). https://t.co/bVtNwP2iXI pic.twitter.com/Wv1cD3aHbf — Lookonchain (@lookonchain) July 25, 2025 Additionally, dormant Bitcoin whales have emerged from extended periods of inactivity to liquidate billions of dollars worth of BTC in recent trading sessions. These combined selling pressures have triggered widespread liquidations, pushing BTC beneath the $116K threshold as the market attempts to find equilibrium. Bitcoin analyst Ki Young Ju has noted a significant shift from the 2021 market cycle, observing that while whales previously sold their holdings to retail investors, the current cycle sees older whales transferring their positions to newer long-term institutional holders. #Bitcoin cycle theory is dead. My predictions were based on it—buy when whales accumulate, sell when retail joins. But that pattern no longer holds. Last cycle, whales sold to retail. This time, old whales sell to new long-term whales. Institutional adoption is bigger than we… — Ki Young Ju (@ki_young_ju) July 24, 2025 Nevertheless, institutional investors and long-term holders continue to capitalize on price dips. Prominent crypto entrepreneur Arthur Hayes maintains a bullish outlook, projecting that Bitcoin could achieve a 100% appreciation from current levels to reach approximately $250,000 by the end of 2025. Bitcoin Price Prediction: RSI Hits 37.8 Oversold Levels From a technical perspective, the 4-hour BTC/USDT chart reveals that Bitcoin is navigating a period of heightened volatility, currently positioned around $116,041, following a recovery from the lower boundaries of a significant CME gap zone. Significantly, Bitcoin is trading beneath the descending support trendline, which has reversed its role to become resistance, reinforcing the current bearish framework. Source: TradingView Above the present price action sits a fair value gap (FVG) spanning $119,000–$121,000, which could serve as a potential target should bullish momentum return. Examining the RSI indicator, it recently touched oversold conditions near 37.8 before showing modest signs of recovery. The RSI’s current behavior suggests short-term bearish momentum may be waning, potentially supporting a corrective bounce. Bitcoin Hyper Raises $4.8M in Explosive Presale With Bitcoin trading above $115,000, many investors are turning to early-stage cryptos with bigger upside potential. One of the most talked-about projects right now is Bitcoin Hyper ($HYPER) — a new meme coin built on Bitcoin’s legacy, but reimagined for speed, scalability, and fun. The presale has already raised over $4.8 million , with growing buzz on crypto Twitter and YouTube. Source: Bitcoin Hyper Popular influencers like Borch Crypto have praised it as “original” and called it one of the top opportunities of the year. Right now, HYPER tokens are available for just $0.0124 , but that price won’t last — the next increase kicks in automatically in less than 30 hours . You can buy directly from the official Bitcoin Hyper website , using SOL, ETH, USDT, USDC, BNB, or even a credit card. headline: Bitcoin Whale Unleashed: Historic $457M Move After 14.5 Years
summary: BitcoinWorld Bitcoin Whale Unleashed: Historic $457M Move After 14.5 Years The cryptocurrency world thrives on constant motion, but every so often, a truly monumental event sends ripples across the digital ocean. Imagine a colossal treasure chest, sealed for nearly a decade and a half, suddenly creaking open. This isn’t a scene from a fantasy novel; it’s the reality of a long-dormant Bitcoin whale , an entity that has just made its first significant move in 14.5 years, sending shockwaves of curiosity and speculation through the market. For those closely observing the digital asset landscape, the sudden activity of a wallet inactive since January 2011 is nothing short of remarkable. This particular wallet, holding a staggering 3,963 BTC—worth approximately $457 million at current prices—has broken its long silence. The question on everyone’s mind: What prompted this awakening, and what might it mean for the broader crypto ecosystem? What Does a Dormant Bitcoin Whale ‘s Awakening Signify? In the lexicon of cryptocurrency, a ‘whale’ refers to an individual or entity holding a substantial amount of a particular digital asset. When a Bitcoin whale of this magnitude, one that has remained dormant for such an extended period, suddenly stirs, it naturally captures the attention of investors, analysts, and enthusiasts alike. The last time these particular Bitcoins saw any movement, the price of a single BTC was a mere $0.32. This translates to an astronomical profit margin, making the owner’s decision to finally move funds a subject of intense scrutiny. The significance of such an event lies in several factors: Rarity: Wallets remaining untouched for over a decade are exceptionally rare. Their sudden activation often signals a major shift in the holder’s strategy or circumstances. Market Impact Potential: While this whale’s holdings are substantial, the immediate market impact depends on the nature of the transaction. A full liquidation could introduce significant selling pressure, whereas a smaller transfer might indicate a test or rebalancing. Psychological Effect: The very act of a long-dormant whale moving funds can influence market sentiment, sparking both excitement and caution among participants. It reminds us of the early days of Bitcoin and the foresight of its pioneers. This particular Bitcoin whale ‘s move is a powerful reminder of the incredible long-term gains possible in the cryptocurrency space and the unique characteristics of its early adopters. Understanding the Mechanics: How This Bitcoin Whale ‘s Transaction Unfolded The details of this historic transaction provide crucial insights into the whale’s intentions. The wallet, identified by its long period of inactivity, transferred 50 BTC out of its massive holdings. This 50 BTC was sent to an address that has been previously associated with major cryptocurrency entities such as Coinbase, B2C2, and Galaxy Digital. These are well-known names in the crypto world, often serving as exchanges, prime brokers, or institutional trading desks. Here’s a snapshot of the transaction’s key figures: Metric Details Wallet Inactivity Period 14.5 years (since January 2011) Total BTC Held 3,963 BTC Current Value of Holdings Approximately $457 million Original Acquisition Cost per BTC $0.32 Amount Transferred 50 BTC Estimated Profit on Transferred BTC Over $5.7 million (based on current prices) Recipient Addresses Associated with Coinbase, B2C2, Galaxy Digital The transfer of 50 BTC, while significant in absolute terms, represents a relatively small fraction of the whale’s total 3,963 BTC holdings. This partial movement could indicate several possibilities: A Test Transaction: Whales often send a small amount first to ensure the address is correct and the transaction goes through smoothly before initiating larger transfers. Liquidity Provision: Moving funds to exchanges or trading desks could mean the whale intends to sell a portion of their holdings, potentially through over-the-counter (OTC) desks to minimize market impact. Rebalancing or Diversification: The whale might be moving funds to different wallets, consolidating holdings, or preparing to diversify into other assets or financial instruments. Custodial Transfer: It’s also possible the whale is moving funds to a new custodian or a more secure storage solution. The fact that the funds were sent to addresses associated with institutional players suggests a sophisticated approach, likely aimed at managing such a large sum discreetly and efficiently. Historical Precedents: The Impact of Past Bitcoin Whale Movements This isn’t the first time a large Bitcoin holder has made headlines with significant transactions. Earlier this year, another major holder offloaded approximately 80,000 BTC, which had a noticeable, albeit temporary, impact on market dynamics. However, the current Bitcoin whale ‘s activity, involving a transfer of 50 BTC, is of a much smaller scale compared to such massive sell-offs. As shared by ai_9684xtpa on X, the market impact of this specific 50 BTC transfer is expected to be limited. This assessment is crucial because not all whale movements are created equal. The cryptocurrency market has matured significantly since 2011, boasting far greater liquidity and a wider range of participants, including institutional investors. This increased depth helps absorb larger transactions without causing extreme volatility. Historically, large movements of BTC from dormant wallets have often been met with apprehension, as they could signal impending selling pressure. However, recent trends show that such movements are increasingly diversified in their purpose: Profit Realization: The most straightforward reason, cashing out substantial gains accumulated over years. Security Upgrades: Moving funds to new, more secure addresses or hardware wallets. Estate Planning: For very old wallets, the movement could be related to estate management or transfer of ownership. Lending or DeFi Participation: Though less common for extremely old coins, some whales engage in decentralized finance (DeFi) protocols or lending platforms. Understanding these historical precedents helps contextualize the current event and allows for a more nuanced interpretation beyond simple fear of selling. Navigating the Waters: What This Bitcoin Whale Activity Means for Investors For everyday investors, the activity of a Bitcoin whale can be both fascinating and a source of anxiety. While the immediate impact of this 50 BTC transfer is deemed limited, it serves as an important reminder of the underlying dynamics of the crypto market. Here are some actionable insights and considerations: Don’t Panic: A single whale’s transaction, especially a relatively small one compared to their total holdings, should not be the sole basis for investment decisions. The market is complex and influenced by numerous factors. Monitor On-Chain Data: Tools and platforms that track whale movements and large transactions can provide valuable insights into market sentiment and potential shifts in supply. While not predictive, they offer transparency. Consider the Broader Context: Look at macroeconomic indicators, regulatory news, technological developments within Bitcoin, and overall market trends rather than isolated events. Understand Liquidity: The current market has significant liquidity, which helps cushion the impact of large transactions. A few hundred million dollars moving around is less impactful now than it would have been a few years ago. Long-Term vs. Short-Term: For long-term investors, minor whale movements are typically noise. For short-term traders, they might present brief opportunities or risks, but careful analysis is always required. This event underscores the importance of a well-informed and diversified investment strategy, emphasizing that the actions of even the largest holders are just one piece of the intricate crypto puzzle. The awakening of this ancient Bitcoin whale is a captivating narrative in the ongoing story of cryptocurrency. It highlights the immense wealth created for early adopters and the fascinating transparency offered by blockchain technology, allowing us to witness such monumental transfers in real-time. While the market’s initial reaction has been muted, this event serves as a potent reminder of the significant players operating behind the scenes and the potential for long-term HODLing strategies to yield life-changing returns. As the crypto market continues to evolve, tracking the movements of these colossal holders will remain a key aspect of on-chain analysis. Whether this whale plans further moves, or if this was simply a strategic rebalancing, only time will tell. What is clear, however, is that the saga of Bitcoin continues to unfold with unexpected twists and turns, reinforcing its status as a truly revolutionary asset. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) 1. What is a Bitcoin whale? A Bitcoin whale is an individual or entity that holds a very large amount of Bitcoin, typically enough to potentially influence market prices if they were to buy or sell significant portions of their holdings. The exact threshold for being considered a whale varies, but it generally refers to wallets holding thousands of BTC. 2. Why is a dormant whale moving funds significant? The movement of funds from a long-dormant wallet is significant because it indicates activity from an early adopter who has held their coins for many years, often since Bitcoin’s infancy. Such moves can signal profit-taking, a change in strategy, or a security update, and can sometimes cause market speculation due to the sheer volume of coins involved. 3. Will this specific transaction impact Bitcoin’s price? While any whale movement can cause speculation, the transfer of 50 BTC from this particular dormant whale is considered to have a limited market impact, especially given the current liquidity and depth of the Bitcoin market. Analysts suggest it might be a test transaction or a move to an OTC desk rather than a direct market sell-off. 4. How can I track Bitcoin whale movements? You can track Bitcoin whale movements using various on-chain analytics platforms and blockchain explorers. Websites like Whale Alert, Glassnode, and CryptoQuant provide data and alerts on large transactions, wallet movements, and other on-chain metrics that can help identify significant whale activity. 5. What does it mean if funds are sent to Coinbase or B2C2? When funds are sent to addresses associated with exchanges like Coinbase or trading firms like B2C2 and Galaxy Digital, it often implies the intention to sell, trade, or utilize institutional services. These entities facilitate large transactions, potentially through over-the-counter (OTC) desks, which allow whales to sell large amounts without directly impacting the open market price. Did this deep dive into the mysterious world of Bitcoin whales intrigue you? Share this article with your friends, fellow investors, and anyone curious about the seismic shifts happening in the crypto market! Let’s keep the conversation going. To learn more about the latest Bitcoin trends, explore our article on key developments shaping Bitcoin price action. This post Bitcoin Whale Unleashed: Historic $457M Move After 14.5 Years first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

headline: Strategy Doubles Down on Bitcoin with $2.47B Preferred Stock Offering
summary: Nasdaq-listed firm Strategy has announced a significant move to raise new funds through the sale of a special class of stock. This step is part of its ongoing plan to invest heavily in Bitcoin (BTC). The deal is expected to be completed by July 29, and Strategy anticipates receiving approximately $2.47 billion after deducting fees and expenses. These funds will be used to support general business operations, including the purchase of additional Bitcoin and covering daily operational expenses. $2.47B Capital Raise Through Preferred Stock Offering In a recent press statement, Strategy shared plans to sell 28 million shares of its Series A Stretch Preferred Stock (STRC). Each share will be priced at $90 through an initial public offering (IPO). The new STRC Stock will pay investors a monthly dividend at a 9% yearly rate based on a $100 value per share. These payments are scheduled to begin on August 31, pending approval by the company’s board. Strategy also has the option to adjust the dividend rate depending on market conditions, but this will be done within set limits. If the company fails to pay dividends on time, interest will build on the missed payments. Once the STRC shares are listed on a U.S. stock exchange, Strategy can choose to buy back some. The company would pay $101 per share, along with any unpaid dividends. However, for any partial buyback, there must still be at least $250 million worth of STRC shares left. Strategy’s Massive Bitcoin Holdings Continue to Grow Strategy recently revealed it has acquired 6,220 Bitcoin units for about $739.8 million , at an average price of $118,940 per coin. This latest purchase was made between July 14 and July 20. This brings the company’s crypto total stash to 607,770 BTC, worth over $71 billion. This makes Strategy one of the largest corporate holders of Bitcoin in the world, outpacing Nvidia . This continued investment highlights Executive Chairman Michael Saylor’s strong belief in Bitcoin as a long-term store of value. Saylor views the top coin as “digital energy” and a shield against inflation and economic instability. His bold approach has encouraged many other companies to think about adding digital assets to their balance sheets. Market Response and Stock Performance As of July 25, Strategy’s Class A stock (MSTR) closed at $414.92. While there was no change during regular trading, pre-market trading showed a 2.30% dip, with the stock priced at $405.37. Notably, the stock has experienced significant fluctuations in the past year. Effectively, it reached a high of $543.00 and a low of $102.40. This illustrates how closely the company’s stock price is tied to the value of Bitcoin. Despite the volatility, Strategy boasts a market value of $116.58 billion. This makes it the most relevant Bitcoin stock in the market. The post Strategy Doubles Down on Bitcoin with $2.47B Preferred Stock Offering appeared first on TheCoinrise.com .

headline: Has the Altcoin Season Started, Will It? Or Will It Never Start? Top Analysts Answer!
summary: While altcoins have experienced a huge rise in recent days, led by Ethereum (ETH), the expectation of an altcoin season is increasing in the market. The strong performance of altcoins is attributed to strong institutional buying, with data showing a recent surge in institutional funds into Ethereum, XRP, and Solana. In addition to increased institutional inflows, the passage of the US stablecoin regulation law, the GENIUS Act, is also cited as one of the factors fueling the altcoin bull run. At this point, analysis companies and analysts expect the altcoin season to begin soon. Is Altcoin Season Near? Analysis firm Swissblock noted that Bitcoin (BTC) dominance is falling and funds are shifting from BTC to altcoins. “When this happens, when BTC dominance declines and funds generally shift towards altcoins, a strong altcoin season occurs. Currently, as Bitcoin's upward momentum slows, capital rotation has begun, and if this trend continues, we could be entering a full-fledged altcoin season. Bitfinex analysts also believe an altcoin rally is imminent. They noted that the current situation could be the start of an altcoin season, with investors more interested in altcoins than BTC. “Investors are shifting their funds from Bitcoin to altcoins to capture further upside potential. This signals the start of an altcoin-centric period in the overall bull market.” While analysts at Bitfinex and Swissblock are expecting an altcoin rally, one analyst argued that it is difficult for altcoins to experience a sudden surge unlike previous cycles. “As Ethereum starts to rally, there's a high probability that liquidity will flow into altcoins more broadly, but at the same time, it will be difficult to see sudden and sharp gains of more than 100x for the majority of altcoins as in the past. The uptrend will likely continue for altcoins with solid fundamentals, such as a real user base and revenue generation,” said Kyung-pil Jang, Head of Research at Xangle. *This is not investment advice. Continue Reading: Has the Altcoin Season Started, Will It? Or Will It Never Start? Top Analysts Answer!

headline: Is $1 Dogecoin ‚Inevitable‘? Analyst Cites Perfect Storm Of Factors
summary: Dogecoin could be approaching a structural breakout that carries it to the long-discussed $1 threshold, according to crypto analyst Stephan Burns, who in a July 24 livestream described a “perfect storm” of monetary design, market structure and what he characterizes as rare astrological alignments. Burns framed the move as an “inevitability,” while acknowledging timing uncertainty, arguing that the next parabolic advance could emerge within months. Is $1 Dogecoin Inevitable? Burns built his case first on tokenomics. Dogecoin’s fixed issuance of 10,000 DOGE per one-minute block—approximately 5.2 billion DOGE annually—translates today into an inflation rate of roughly 3.3% against a circulating supply he placed at 150 billion. With that supply base, he said, the network simultaneously sustains miner incentives, gradually replaces lost coins and avoids the periodic “supply shocks” embedded in Bitcoin’s quadrennial halving schedule. “It’s beautiful because of this inflation rate,” he said, calling Dogecoin “better as a currency than Bitcoin” precisely because of its predictability. By contrast, he argued, Bitcoin’s declining issuance—on track to fall below half a percent after the 2028 halving—forces a future reliance on transaction fees. “Eventually Bitcoin will be completely mined… the network has to be maintained by transaction fees. That’s probably not enough to incentivize miners at the end of the day,” Burns claims. Related Reading: Dogecoin Retests Crucial Support Following 8.6% Drop – Here Are The Levels To Watch He also asserted that Dogecoin’s governance surface is harder to co-opt than Bitcoin’s as large institutional and governmental actors accumulate BTC exposure. In his view, Dogecoin remains “the people’s currency,” with economic dilution limited by social and technical difficulty of altering code. The flat nominal issuance, he added, produces a declining percentage inflation rate over time without rendering the asset strictly deflationary or, in his words, vulnerable to miner attrition. Beyond economics, Burns devoted extensive time to what he calls “crypto astrology,” arguing that Dogecoin’s natal chart—anchored to its genesis block—now sits under exceptionally favorable transits. He highlighted Pluto’s conjunction with Dogecoin’s natal Moon, describing it as “a once in a roughly 250-year transit,” and an impending Jupiter return with the planet “exalted” near the project’s midheaven point. These, he claimed, historically correspond to phases of visibility, capital inflow and wealth symbolism. “Dogecoin is being activated… more than any other cryptocurrency this year,” he said, labeling the configuration a catalyst for renewed global attention. Burns linked those internal transits to a broader macro cycle, citing the approaching Saturn–Neptune conjunction at the first degrees of Aries in early 2026, which he associated—through earlier historical recurrences—with milestones such as the emergence of coinage and trade networks. Related Reading: Dogecoin Rally On Thin Ice: Analyst Predicts Sudden Shakeout In his view, that backdrop reinforces the plausibility of another speculative wave. A logarithmic review of Dogecoin’s price history, he said, shows three prior “parabolic” expansions separated by lengthening consolidation phases; the current basing structure, including what he described as an ascending W-pattern supported by long-term moving averages, could precede a fourth. “Just based off of that it looks like we may be due for another one of these parabolic moves up in the next few months,” he said, while conceding that “just because I think it doesn’t mean it’s going to happen.” He further projected that a Dogecoin exchange-traded fund “will get approved” and place the asset “in the spotlight,” though he did not provide documentation beyond his expectation. Burns also contrasted Dogecoin’s relative resilience on its Bitcoin ratio with altcoins that have reverted to prior ranges, arguing that structural holding above pre-2020 levels supports his thesis. Summarizing his outlook, Burns reiterated what he called the “inevitability of Dogecoin going to $1,” framing that level as the maximal target in his public analysis for the forthcoming cycle. The timing, he implied, hinges on the interplay between tokenomics-driven accumulation and the unfolding of the transits he tracks. “I do think it’s going to moon,” he concluded. At press time, DOGE traded at $0.23. Featured image created with DALL.E, chart from TradingView.com

headline: ETH LEADS, MONEY SUPPLY HITS ATH, PUNKS CONTINUE TO SURGE
summary: BTC dips as jobs data diminishes Fed rate cut hopes. US crypto inflows surge hit $60b YTD. Strategy increases pref stock offering to $2b. Tokyo’s Quantum Solutions plans to buy 3k BTC. WindTree Therapeutics raises $520m to buy BNB. Expect stablecoin supply to surge $75b: BofA. Celestia Foundation buys $62.5m TIA. TON Foundation, Kingsway to launch treasury firm. Tron Inc. enters Nasdaq. Christie’s launches $1b real estate division for crypto. Zircuit launches AI trading engine. Woo X hacked for $12m
